messages.page_content:
- Topic: Roll Call and Attendance
- Summary: The roll call was conducted at the beginning of the meeting, with Councilmembers Banks, Giarrusso, Glapion, Moreno, and Nguyen present. Councilmembers Brossett and Gisleson Palmer arrived later.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (5 present, 2 absent)
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Roll Call, Attendance, Councilmembers
- UID: aabbb1b7-468d-4b0f-a4d8-bfaa8689cc17

- Topic: Public Comment Rules and Meeting Procedure
- Summary: The council discussed the public comment rules and meeting procedure, emphasizing the need to operate in a virtual fashion due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Citizens were allowed to submit written comments for any agenda item, with specific guidelines for the submission process and time limits for comments.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The council followed the Louisiana Attorney General's guidelines for public comments and meeting procedures. Special orders of business were temporarily postponed due to the pandemic.
- Tags/Keywords: Public comment, virtual meeting, COVID-19, Louisiana Attorney General
- UID: 1d4b4670-8b7e-4f5f-a0fb-5d247c645136

- Topic: Consent Agenda Communication from Theresa R. Becher
- Summary: The council received a communication from Theresa R. Becher, Council Research Officer, New Orleans City Council, which was part of the consent agenda.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The communication was included in the consent agenda and did not require a separate vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Consent agenda, communication, New Orleans City Council
- UID: 1d4b4670-8b7e-4f5f-a0fb-5d247c645136

- Topic: Deferral of Agenda Items for February 25, 2021 Regular Council Meeting
- Summary: Recommended agenda items for deferrals for the February 25, 2021 Regular Council meeting due to the COVID-19 pandemic were submitted electronically for consideration.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: Not applicable
- Decision/Key Actions: The agenda items were submitted for deferral due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
- Tags/Keywords: Deferral, Agenda Items, COVID-19, Regular Council Meeting
- UID: 8cb9aba7-e177-4550-a8f2-c62e2aeb72de

- Topic: Communications Related to Electric and Gas Utility Matters
- Summary: Communications related to electric and gas utility matters were submitted for consideration at the February 25, 2021 Council meeting, including reports from Entergy New Orleans, LLC and the Council's Utility Advisors.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: Not applicable
- Decision/Key Actions: The communications related to electric and gas utility matters were submitted for consideration at the Council meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric Utility, Gas Utility, Communications, Entergy New Orleans, Council's Utility Advisors
- UID: 8cb9aba7-e177-4550-a8f2-c62e2aeb72de

- Topic: Permanent Polling Relocation for Ward/Precinct 15/08
- Summary: Requesting a permanent polling relocation for ward/precinct 15/08 from McDonogh #32 School to Arthur Monday M.S.C. as per La. R.S. 18:534 (B)(1).
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The request for permanent polling relocation for ward/precinct 15/08 passed without any opposition.
- Tags/Keywords: Polling Relocation, Ward/Precinct 15/08, La. R.S. 18:534 (B)(1)
- UID: f62b1108-e674-430a-8c73-5d6080cd01b5

- Topic: Permanent Polling Relocation for Wards/Precincts 2/07, 14/26, & 17/09
- Summary: Requesting a permanent polling relocation for wards/precincts 2/07, 14/26, & 17/09 from Xavier University's Student Center to its Convocation Center as per La. R.S. 18:534 (B)(1).
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The request for permanent polling relocation for wards/precincts 2/07, 14/26, & 17/09 passed without any opposition.
- Tags/Keywords: Polling Relocation, Wards/Precincts 2/07, 14/26, & 17/09, La. R.S. 18:534 (B)(1)
- UID: f62b1108-e674-430a-8c73-5d6080cd01b5

- Topic: Appeal of Historic District Landmarks Commission's Decision

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion overruling the HDLC's "denial" and granting the applicant's appeal, subject to the proviso, passed with 5 YEAS and 2 NAYS.

- UID: db5dc858-d009-4502-8983-6bb1cd009a7d

- Topic: HDLC Appeal of Alexandra Meyn Design, LLC
- Summary: The appeal was for altering windows of a property at 2820-2826 St. Claude Avenue to match the historic facade. The motion to deny the appeal was submitted.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-77
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to deny the appeal was passed.

- Summary: Motion GRANTING the conditional use extension for a fast food restaurant with drive-through to Ordnance No. 27975 MCS (ZD 107/18) for one additional year.

- Topic: Request for Text Amendment to Establish Algiers Riverfront Overlay District
- Summary: Requesting a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to establish the Algiers Riverfront Overlay District, with specific boundaries and design standards.
- Ordinance Number: M-20-400
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Request for a text amendment to be considered for further review and discussion.
- Tags/Keywords: Text Amendment, Zoning Ordinance, Algiers Riverfront
- UID: 73ecbd45-2e91-4a1f-90be-caae13910c42

- Topic: Text Amendment for Riverfront Overlay RIV-2 Algiers Sub-District Standards
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amending the existing Riverfront Overlay RIV-2 Algiers Sub-District Standards to add a possible parking bonus as an affordable housing incentive. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "Modified Approval".
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO 3/21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a vote of 7 YEAS.
- Tags/Keywords: Riverfront Overlay, Affordable Housing, Zoning Code, City Planning
- UID: 1710c6ac-b453-47e3-884d-e29798ce6617

- Topic: Text Amendment for Brown’s Dairy Affordable Housing Homeownership District
- Summary: The ordinance requested a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create the "Brown’s Dairy Affordable Housing Homeownership District" for the purpose of providing additional flexibility in the redevelopment of certain sites to allow for the creation of affordable housing homeownership opportunities. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR MODIFIED APPROVAL".
- Ordinance Number: Zoning Docket No. 4/21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a vote of 7 YEAS.
- Tags/Keywords: Affordable Housing, Zoning Ordinance, City Planning Commission, Redevelopment
- UID: 1710c6ac-b453-47e3-884d-e29798ce6617

- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 5/21 — RENEWAL HOMES II, LLC
- Summary: Request for conditional use to permit a neighborhood commercial establishment in an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR APPROVAL", subject to seven provisos.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 4/21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- UID: 2461d4f4-55ee-4181-9cff-4abc9d8c3820

- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 6/21 — BRYANT G. RICE
- Summary: Request for conditional use to permit a three-unit multi-family residence in an HMR-3 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Residential District and an RDO-1! Residential Diversity Overlay District. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR APPROVAL", subject to seven provisos.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 5/21
- Votes Summary:

- UID: 2461d4f4-55ee-4181-9cff-4abc9d8c3820

- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 7/21
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Amendment of Section 26-15 of the City Code
- Summary: An ordinance to amend and reordain Section 26-15 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, relative to peer review of structural design and inspection by engineers of record during construction.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Postponed to a later date)

- Topic: Structural Design and Inspection Peer Review
- Summary: An ordinance to specify where peer reviews and inspections of structural design are required, how and by whom they are to be performed.

- Votes Summary:

- UID: ce4a7e5e-48a3-4e0a-a2a6-9466b682ab08

- Topic: Amendment to Section 50-86 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the Code to grant certain members of the Department of Public Works the authority to take oaths and verify affidavits for issuing citations for certain offenses on the public right of way. It also grants certain employees of the New Orleans Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness the authority to take oaths and verify affidavits for certain employees of the same office.
- Ordinance Number: 33155
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Department of Public Works, Homeland Security, Amendment, Code of the City, Authority
- UID: 90d6c120-bea0-4c7b-bab7-4f0da6fa9c63

- Topic: Amendment to Section 66-282 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to provide authorization for certain Department of Public Works employees to issue summons for certain violations on the public right of way.
- Ordinance Number: 33156
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Department of Public Works, Violations, Code of the City, Authorization
- UID: 90d6c120-bea0-4c7b-bab7-4f0da6fa9c63

- Summary: This ordinance aims to grant a planned development in a specific district, including the authorization for certain actions related to the development.

- UID: 90d6c120-bea0-4c7b-bab7-4f0da6fa9c63

- Summary: The ordinance aims to authorize the City of New Orleans to enter into the first amendment to the lease agreement with TCI PACKAGING, LLC for specific properties, fix the rental payment schedule, and declare that the leased property is not needed for public purposes during the lease term.
- Ordinance Number: 33214
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease Agreement, TCI PACKAGING, Property Lease, City of New Orleans

- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend Section 26-160 of the Code of the City of New Orleans to require property owners to keep grass below 10 inches.
- Ordinance Number: 33238
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Vacant Property Protection Program
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to create the Vacant Property Protection Program, allowing the owner of a vacant and unimproved parcel of property to authorize the New Orleans Police Department to enter the property to address criminal trespass and blight.
- Ordinance Number: 33244

- Topic: Monthly Reporting Requirements for Code Enforcement
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish monthly reporting requirements for the Department of Code Enforcement regarding determinations of Order to Vacate and Blight and Public Nuisance.

- Summary: The motion aims to permanently relocate the official polling places for ward/precincts 2/07, 14/26, 17/09, and 15/08.

- Topic: Resolution to endorse efforts for historic preservation of Southern Pacific 745
- Summary: The council discussed and voted on Resolution R-21-73, which endorses the efforts of LASTA and encourages the Johanna Favrot Fund for Historic Preservation to provide funds to rehabilitate and restore Southern Pacific 745, the last surviving steam locomotive built in Louisiana.

- Votes Summary:
